line.en: My first job as dorm mother.
That is, to make breakfast for the boarders.
'Munch, munch... That's some good eatin'!'
'Aoi, you're good at cooking. Can I have some\nmore rice?'
'Sure. A big bowl, right?'
'You know it!'
I'm pretty confident in my cooking.
Until recently, I was living with my father who\nwas transferred to the countryside, and every day\nI helped with the housework.
I was in charge of preparing the meals and it's\nnot like I hated cooking or anything.
That's one of the reasons why I accepted the job\nas dorm mother.
'So the others don't need breakfast, huh...?'
Until now, no one has come into the dining hall.
Sometimes there would be someone walking through\nthe hallway in front, but they seem to be\nsneaking around.
'Hmmmm?'
Kanako looked towards the hallway, just as the\noldest boarder Yuka was peeking in before swiftly\ndashing off.
'Geez, they're all so naive. They still haven't\ngotten used to boys.'
'But Keifuu is a coed school, right?'
'Even if you go to the same school, you won't see\nthem with their bed-head and faces without\nmakeup.'
'I see...'
It seems that a guy being the dorm mother of a\ngirl's dormitory will have its problems after\nall.
There is a reason why I accepted the job as dorm\nmother at 'Flying Fish Manor'.
Not long ago, the owner-janitor collapsed.
It sounds like she was pretty old and in addition\nto straining her back, she caught a summer cold,\nwhich worsened.
The owner soon began looking for a replacement\nbut it was hard to find one.
Then, she sought help from the real estate\ncompany where my mother works.
This is one of the properties that my mom\nmanages, and is an old acquaintance of the owner\nfrom decades ago.
She nominated me for this job, just as I was\nplanning to come back here.

On the documents, my mom is the one responsible
for this place but she got me to carry out the
practical duties, in other words, the work of the
dorm mother.
Then, that became the condition for me coming\nback to this town.
As always, she's very crafty but I wasn't really\nagainst the idea, so I accepted.
'(If I had known it was a girl's dormitory, of\ncourse, I would've refused...!)'
This place is old and a little far from the\nschool but the rent is cheap.
Apart from the food and admin expenses, it costs\nnext to nothing.

That's why it would be a big problem for me if I
couldn't stay here, and in the worst case
scenario, the boarders won't be able to go to
school.
'Thanks for the meal. Whew, that was good!'
Kanako stacked up the dishes on the counter and\nlicked her lips in satisfaction.
'Everyone will get used to you soon! Well then,\nI'm off now!'
She had eaten it all, not even a single grain of\nrice was left.
'To have people enjoy my cooking feels pretty\ngood.'
I feel deeply relieved. I'm happy that things are\ngoing well.
'Aw geez! I'd better get ready for school.'
In the entrance of the dormitory, there was\nKotori.
She was dressed in her uniform and looked like\nshe was about to go to school.
'Morning Kotori.'
'M...morning.'
'Are you going to school? Shall we go together?'
'Huh... why do you wanna do that...?'
'Why?... Well...'
'If you're worried about my legs, then there's no\nneed. Hmph!'
She put it bluntly as she quickly went out the\nfront door.
'I don't have any friends at school, so I was\njust asking...'
It looked like we had a strange misunderstanding.
Wearing my new uniform, I made my way to school.
I'm a dorm mother but also a student of Keifuu\nAcademy. I mean, this is my real occupation.
Today is the first day at my new school.
I'm not really the shy type but I guess I am kind\nof nervous.
I would say that the school I was going to before\nwas a sports-focused all-boys school.
Keifuu Academy, the school I'll be going to now,\nis a coed engineering school and the school\ntraditions are quite different too.
As I walked along the streets that lead to\nschool, there are more and more groups of people\nwearing the same uniform.

This is the same area in which I lived five years
ago. There should be a few people that I know but
most of the people who I'd recognize went on to
regular schools.
I wonder if the ones who chose to go to Keifuu\nAcademy remember me?
'Even if I only get to know one person, it would\nmake a big difference.'
There'll be more weird misunderstandings with\nMiss 'Allule' too.
'Oh yeah, which school do Ageha and the others go\nto?'
They're my childhood friends who I always played\nwith when I was a kid.
There's Ageha, Ma-bou, Hotaru and An-chan.
Out of that group, Ageha and Ma-bou are the same\nage as me but...
We haven't met in five years and haven't really\nstayed in touch.
We barely manage to exchange New Year cards\nbut...

That reminds me, in the corner of last year's New
Year card, I think there was a small message
about which school we were planning to go to.
What did it say?
A lot of things happened, or maybe I'm just lazy,\nbut I haven't told anyone apart from An-chan that\nI'm coming back.
To be honest, I'm not even sure how I should act\nif I met them...
'With people like Ageha, she'd probably smash my\nface in! She'd say 'Why didn't you contact\nme...!!' or something.'
'She looked and acted like a real tomboy.'
When I remember the past, it makes me smile\nbut...
At the intersection leading to school, there was\na girl wearing a Keifuu uniform standing there,\nlooking towards me.
The other girls that she was walking to school\nwith asked 'What's up?' and seemed puzzled as\nthey spoke to her.
However, it seems that the girl couldn't hear\nthem and she's looking over here, at me.
Just faintly, her eyes seemed full of surprise.
'(She's pretty cute...)'
Without realizing, I'd stopped walking and was\nstaring at the girl.
Until a few days ago, I was going to an all-boys\nschool.
The sight of a girl on the way to school in her\nuniform (she was pretty cute too) caused me to\ntremble is perfectly reasonable.
'Is that you... Aoi?'
'Yes... it is.'
Suddenly having someone call my name in such a\ncarefree manner, made me feel a little nervous.
...Who is it?
'It is you, Aoi!' No way, it really is you!'
There, she said my name again and she has such a\nhappy expression on her face.
Do I know any girls this cute?
No, wait, I've seen this face before...
When she smiles like this, and her eyes sparkle\nlike a little kid's...
'...Is that you, Ageha?'
'Yeah, of course, it's me, Ageha! Did you forget\nmy face?'
She asked as she briskly moved closer, bringing\nher face right up to mine.
It's definitely Ageha... She's changed a lot but\nif I just look at her face, there's no doubt that\nit's her.
'Is it really 'that' Ageha!?'
'Yeah, very funny. How many other Agehas do you\nknow!?'
'100 percent authentic, the real Ageha Himegi!'
'What is it, what is it?' said the other girls as\nthey gathered round in a circle.
Ageha turned to face them and introduced me.
'This is Aoi Minase. He's a transfer student. You\nremember him, don't you Sacchin?'
Sacchin replied 'No way, Aoi?' as she warmly\nraised her voice in surprise.
When we were in the fourth grade of elementary\nschool, we were in the same class once.
'Aoi and I are childhood friends. He used to live\nhere but he got transferred to another school,\nright?'
The girls seemed impressed by Ageha's explanation\nand they looked at me with eyes full of\nexpectation.
'Nice to meet you, I'm Aoi Minase.'
In front of all these girls in their uniforms, I\ngreeted them with a stern look on my face as I\ntried to hide my embarrassment.
Ageha laughed as she looked on with relish.
I never thought I would find myself doing\nintroductions in the street on the way to school\nlike this, so I was totally unprepared.
I'll say it again! Let me do it again!!
'You've gotten taller. I didn't recognize you at\nfirst.'
As she spoke, Ageha was moving her hands around\nmy head, to show the difference in height between\nmyself and her.
Our bodies were making contact but she either\ndidn't notice or didn't really mind.
I flinched slightly but the fact that she was so\nunreserved actually made me feel more\ncomfortable.
'Back in the day, we used to have such good\nmatches! Boys are so unfair...'
'Speaking of which, you've changed too...'
'Really?'
As she said 'You think so?', she looked at\nherself.
'Yeah. You always looked like a boy, so I was\nsurprised to see that you became a girl.'
Those were my honest thoughts but I said them in\na way that sounded weird.
I thought she might find it slightly charming\nbut...
'Hahaha... ...So, I've become quite the woman,\nhaven't I?'
Ageha laughed happily and did a little turn on\nthe spot.
The force of her spin made her skirt float around\ngently.
'...Yeah, it's like you're not really Ageha.'
While dazed and not really thinking, those\nthoughts just kind of slipped out.
'Yay, alright!'
Ageha was pleased and did high fives with her\nfriends.
Seeing her in high spirits like that felt just\nlike old times.
Ageha, my best friend during my childhood hadn't\nchanged in the five years that had passed.
Her appearance was surprising though.
The lessons on my first day at my new school flew\nby in the blink of an eye.
Between the language and social studies lessons\ntaught in regular schools, were those from a\nspecialist curriculum.

I was still in my second year, so I didn't have
many of those classes. But, it appears that when
you go into your third and fourth years, the
number of them increases.
By the way, this is a five year school.
That's why when walking the hallways, this kind\nof thing happens...
'(Hey... She's pretty)'
Coming from an all-boys school, with its sad\ncustoms, I couldn't help my eyes from following\nthe girls as I walked past them.
'...Ho ho! So you're already checking out the\ngirls?'
'No, that's not it! I just... thought that they\nlooked really grown up, that's all.'
'They're seniors from the fourth and fifth years,\naren't they?'
At our age, a gap of three or four years is\npretty big. The students in the upper grades look\nvery mature.
'Also, although this is a specialist school, the\npercentage of girls is pretty high.'
'Huh? Why's that?'
Without thinking, I really took an interest in\nthat, and Ageha looked at me as if she wanted to\ncall me a pervert.
'At the time that the school was rebuilt, they\nmade an effort to accept more girls.'
I'd heard about that before I'd transferred.
They increased the number of courses for girls,\nand asked famous designers to make the designs\nfor the new building.
'It has been said 'Thanks to that, the ratio of\nboys and girls is about 50-50!' which is one of\nthe selling points of the school.

Bearing this in mind, I felt uneasy about
choosing this school as the one I would transfer
to, but I'd like people to think that it can't be
helped because I'm from an all-boys school.
By the way, it's now lunchtime.
Ageha is in the middle of giving me a guided tour\nof the school building.
'Yeah but this really is an amazing school.'
The school itself is pretty old.
Due to it being a special kind of school, of\ncourse, it's famous in the local area. I've known\nabout it too, since I was a little kid.

The school building has been rebuilt over the
last few years, with the renovations divided into
several stages, the last of which was completed
just one year ago.
It's said that was because of the famous\ndesigners.
The design uses many curved lines, so the\nappearance is far removed from what is generally\nassociated with the word 'school'.
It felt like I had entered some kind of sci-fi\nsetting.

'The facilities are first-class too. Air
conditioning, full disabled access, so anyone can
feel peace of mind as they spend their school
days here.'
'Disabled access...?'
That's right, Miss 'Allule', I mean Kotori,\nshould be somewhere in this school.
'But, Aoi, you really have changed...'
Ageha, as she walked by my side, was happily\nmurmuring as she looked at my face.
'In the past, your face was a cute but now, it\nseems more rugged somehow.'
'Yeah, same to you!'
'Hey!! I don't look rugged!'
If she knew that when we met on the way to school\nearlier, I thought 'She's pretty cute', she'd\nnever let it go, so I'd better keep quiet.
'If I hadn't heard it from An-chan, I never\nwould've realized.'
'You heard it from An-chan?'
'Yes. That you were coming back.'
By the way, I'm in the same class as Ageha.
She knew that I might be coming as a transfer\nstudent, which is why she wasn't that surprised\nby our chance meeting this morning.
'Hey you, if you were going to come back, you\nshould've contacted me.'
'S...sorry...'
The reason why we call him 'An-chan' isn't\nbecause he's my older brother.
He was our childhood friend but he was much older\nthan us so we nicknamed him 'An-chan'.
He's not related by blood but he's just like a\nreal big brother.
Ageha glared at me and said 'Geez...' as I tried\nto laugh it off.
'The old me would've made you taste the Axe\nBomber Lariat!'
She wouldn't really have hit me.
As we talked, we went back to the classroom.
The classroom's weren't exactly normal either.
I feel a little uneasy taking lessons here but\nmaybe I'll get used to it sometime soon.
'By the way, there's a girl in a wheelchair in\nthis school, right?'
'Miss Allule... No, I mean, she's called Kotori\nHabane.'
I ask Ageha as we return to our seats.
I didn't ask what grade she was in but even if\nit's not the same, I thought Ageha would at least\nbe aware of her.
'Umm... yeah.'
Ageha reacted like she was being evasive.
It wasn't just Ageha but the other people sitting\nnearby who heard our conversation, also seemed\nkind of awkward.
'If you're after Kotori, she's in this class. It\nlooks like she's not here today though.'
After Ageha said that, someone added 'You mean\n'today either', don't you?
The way she said that seemed quite harsh.
'That can't be. I mean...'
I thought about explaining that she had left the\ndormitory this morning in her uniform, but I held\nmy tongue.
The atmosphere was kind of strange.
'Recently, she's been absent from school for a\nlong time. Seems like she's not feeling well.'
Not feeling well?
Yesterday, she had went out to Windmill Hill, and\nthen later she was chasing that duck around the\nhalls of the dormitory.
And this morning, she left wearing her uniform.
'(Is she skipping school?)'
However, more worrying than what Kotori is up to,\nis the reaction of the others in the class when\nthey heard us talking about her.
Even Ageha looked like she had something she\nwanted to say, but couldn't.
'(But I don't really know what the situation is,\nso I can't really say anything.)'
'Hey, Yamamoto! Can you lend me your English\ndictionary?'
As the awkwardness started to fade, an optimistic\nvoice called out.
From the entrance of the classroom, a carefree\nlooking guy poked his head and started speaking\nto a boy in our class.
'Oh, good timing!'
'Hey, Ma-bou!'
'What is it, Ageha? You want somethin'?'
The guy known as Ma-bou came into the classroom.
'Eri-chan's in a bad mood because you and I are\nfriends.'
'That's what you might call jealousy, right?'
'Whatever, come over here.'
'Huh, who's this? A transfer student? Ageha looks\npretty cute but she's like a dude on the inside,\nso watch out.'
Ageha and I both looked blankly at him for a\nmoment.
'Wh...what!?'
'Long time, no see, Ma-bou.'
'Huh?'
'Why is this transfer student being so\nbuddy-buddy with me?' his face seemed to say.
'It's me. Have you forgotten me?'
'It's 'me', you say...?'
'...Huh? Whaaaaaat!? Is that you, Aoi...!!?'
I looked at Ageha and she...
'Hee hee!'
She wanted to surprise him, so it seems like she\nintentionally didn't tell him.
This slightly superficial guy is Masatsugu\nTasaki, or Ma-bou as we call him.
He's our childhood friend.
'Wh, wh, wh, why is Aoi here!? So, is he a\ntransfer student... huh? What!!?'
'You're way too surprised.'
'Of course I'm surprised! Whaaaat!?'
'You seem well, Ma-bou. You've grown pretty big.'
Masatsugu used to be really small but now he was\nabout the same size as me.

It's not quite like the change in Ageha, but in
the five years that have passed since we were
kids, it looks like he's grown to about twice the
size.
'Y...you too!'
We grabbed each other by the right hand.
This was instead of a small, quiet greeting.
'Is it really you, Aoi...?'
'Yeah, I'm back, Ma-bou.'
'Welcome back... Aoiiiiiiii!'
This time, BAM, he gave me a full-on hug.
'H...hey, hey!'
'Ok, so this is what they call 'passionate\nfriendship', huh?'
We were the only ones who thought so, whereas all\nof the girls around us were totally freaked out.
'I missed you, Aoi...'
'What?'
'...No, not really, you traitor!!!'
Ma-bou suddenly backed off and thrust his finger\nat the end of my nose.
'Wh...what is this all of a sudden?'
'I thought you had just upped and left, and you\ndidn't even contact me!'
'Do you even know what Ageha and I have been\nthrough, you jerk!'
'No, no, no. You can't involve me in this!'
'And after that, how dare you...'
'I'm sorry. But it's not my fault that I had to\nmove away. If you wanna complain, say it to my\ndad.'
'I thought about writing a letter but I felt kind\nof embarrassed.'
For the most part, the fact that there was no\ncontact was both our faults.
'You traitor! I'll never forgive you!'
'I hate you! You're an idiot!'

With saliva flying out of his mouth as he
emphasized his words, Ma-bou forgot all about
borrowing the English dictionary and he stormed
out of the classroom.
'Are you a little kid or something...?'
It wasn't just us but everyone in the classroom\nwas shocked.
'I thought this might happen, which is why I\ndidn't tell him.'
'If he had known, he would been going full\nthrottle like that from the beginning.'
I think that was the correct decision. I want to\nsay 'thank you'.
'Even so, he did seem really upset about it.'
'He recently got a girlfriend and he's really\ninto her.'
'When we were kids, he'd always say 'Aoi...!\nAgeha...! Wait...!' as he followed us everywhere\nwe went.'
'It's fine, he'll soon go back to how he always\nis. That guy really likes you, Aoi!'
'Don't say it like that, it sounds weird.'
'Really? I think it's cute!'
While we carried on talking, the bell to mark the\nend of lunchtime sounded.
Everyone put away their lunchboxes and got ready\nfor the next lesson.
Ageha went back to her seat.
She stopped halfway, then walked back.
'What's up?'
Ageha seemed concerned about those around us and\nlowered her voice.
'...I was wondering how you know about Kotori?'
'Well... The truth is, my mom asked me to be the\ndorm mother of a student dormitory.'
I lowered my voice so that those around us\ncouldn't hear.
'The caretaker of a dormitory?'
'Kotori is boarding there.'
'Oh, really...?'
'My mom asked me to take good care of Kotori.'
Even if she hadn't, I'd be worried about her\nanyway.
As she listened to my explanation, Ageha thought\nit over.
Her expression darkened somehow.
'If it carries on like this, she'll stop coming\naltogether. Everyone's worried about her.'
'It looks like she's not really enjoying school.'
It looked as if she was saying 'I can't believe\nshe doesn't enjoy school!'.
'You seem to enjoy it.'
'Me? Of course I do. It's a fun school, that's\nwhy.'
'I guess.'
It was still my first day at a new school but I\nwas enjoying it quite a lot too.
'Really... Is that so...'
Whether or not she was convinced by my story,\nAgeha mumbled something or other as she returned\nto her seat.
After school.
I was alone and was wandering around the school\nbuilding.
This was so that I could take a look at some of\nthe club activities.
'Film Studies, Theater Club... there's even an\nR.C. Club.'
This is, after all, a specialist school.
Looking at the playing field from the window, in\nthe heat outside, I saw the sports clubs\npracticing.
'Compared to my school, it's pretty calm.'
The sports clubs at the school I used to go to\nwere taken so seriously.
The sight of training before a match was one of\ngrueling harshness.
'...Wait, what do I mean 'my school'?'
I'm a student of this school now.
'I'll go take a look.'
I went down next to the playing field, to watch\nthe sports clubs practicing.
Before long, I started to feel a little down, so\nI left.
'The doctor said that if it's light exercise, it\nshouldn't be a problem.'
I try stomping down strongly with my right foot,\nand there isn't really any discomfort.
There, the baseball club, which was returning\nfrom the off-campus running course, entered\nthrough the school gates.
'Hey, Minase! It's you, Minase, isn't it?'
The one calling me was an old acquaintance.
'It's you, Taguchi! It's been a long time!'
'So you came back? Have you decided which club\nyou want to join?'
'No, not yet. I'm going around taking a look\nright now.'
'Join the baseball club. You'd become a regular\nin no time!'
When I was a kid, I often played baseball in the\npark.
Some of the guys in the group that were my\nteammates or on the other team were in the\nbaseball team.
'I'll think about it.'
I casually responded, and the baseball team\nmembers replied 'C'mon, join us, seriously!' as\nthey returned to the playing field.
'If I could do physical activities, baseball, in\nfact anything, would be OK.'

As I grumbled to myself, I felt that I didn't
want to go back to the playing field, so I
entered the path leading to the back of the
school.
I spend a while walking around the back of the\nschool.
It was called the rear garden but it looked like\nit hadn't been taken care of at all, and was just\nan empty space with weeds growing everywhere.
In that empty space, there was a garage.
'Hello, I'm coming in...'
It looks like no one's here but I thought I\nshould say something to let them know, just in\ncase.
'Is this place used for club activities too?'
Or is it used for lessons?
I don't know what they're used for but there are\nmany tools and parts crammed onto the shelves\nthat cover the walls.
Then, in the center, there is a huge object\ncovered with a sheet.
The feelings that had washed over me like a wave\nwhen I watched the sports clubs, strangely\nsubsided from being here.
The tools and the dimly lit garage must've\nreminded me of the times when I would tinker with\nmy bicycle.
'What is this used for?'
I conceal the sound of my footsteps as I sneak\ninside the garage.
'It's pretty spacious. There's a tea set here\ntoo...'
There was no doubt about it, someone was using\nthis place.
'I get a strange sense of activity. I guess it\nmust be one of the clubs... Whoa!!?'
Th...there's someone here!
I was so surprised, it felt like my heart was\ngoing to jump out...
'Hmmm...'
The person over there seemed not to have noticed\nme at all.
I'm not sure if you could call it a drawing board\nbut as she stared at the plans that were placed\nthere, she was kind of groaning.
'Ummm...'
'I'm sorry for letting myself in here. I'll be\ngoing now.'
It's no good, she didn't hear me.
Her eyes were so serious as she stared at the\nplans, and she looked like she was really\nconcentrating.
I didn't know what to do, so I just looked at her\nfrom the side.
Now that I look closely, she's really beautiful.
'(...Hey, why am I staring at her!?)'
I hurriedly look away.
However, it looks as if she still hasn't noticed\nme, so I take another glimpse.
'(She looks quite mature. Is she a fifth year?)'
'(She's so pretty...)'
Kotori is pretty too but this person is\ndifferent, and has a mysterious charm.
'Hmm!'
Fwoosh!
She suddenly stood up!
'I...I'm sorry!'
Without thinking, I avert my eyes and apologize\nbut she's looking straight...
...past me and grabs a big, thick book from the\nshelf.
'...Yes, that's it!'
She flicked through the pages and looked like she\nhad found something, before going straight back\nto her seat.
In good spirits, she began swiftly drawing the\nplans.
The pen made a nice 'swoosh, swoosh' sound as it\nran across the page.
The feeling of maturity that she had until just\nnow, suddenly changed.
'(When she smiles, all of a sudden, she looks\nmore like a kid...)'
As her eyes looked straight at the plans, they\nlooked as though they had a crystal clear purity\nto them.
Just like an innocent child, her eyes looked as\nthough she believed that the world is full of\nwonderful, sparkling things.
'Ha ha ha... There we go!'
Her hand stopped moving.
I got the timing right.
'Excuse me!'
She finally noticed me!
'Oh, hello.'
Even though I had unexpectedly appeared like\nthat, she didn't show any signs of caution, and\nstill in good spirits, smiled as she greeted me.
I thought that I should say something to her, but\nI couldn't think of what to say after that.
'? What's up?'
'I'm sorry that I just let myself in here.'
'I just transferred here today. I was taking a\nlook at club activities and stumbled in here when\nI got lost.'
I got a little carried away and said more than I\nneeded to but she didn't seem interested at all.
'She looked as me as if to say 'Yes, and?'.
'I don't mind if you let yourself in here.'
It seemed like a kind of blunt way to say it but\nshe wasn't angry or anything.
'(She has a strange way of speaking...)'
'W...well, I'm sorry. I'd better go.'
As I said that like a total loser, a huge sound\nechoed around the garage.
'Wh...what's that noise?'
'Ohh... I'm hungry...'
With a lack of energy in her voice, the beautiful\ngirl before me held her stomach and fell down\nonto the drawing board.
'Was that the sound of your stomach just now!?'
We're inside the garage, so the sound echoed like\ncrazy and sounded like the growl of a monster.
'Mmmm... looks like my body just remembered that\nmy stomach is empty.'
She seemed to sway as she tried to get up but she\ndidn't have enough energy, so she slumped back\ndown with her cheek on the drawing board.
'Would you like to eat this?'
I took some bread out of my bag.
I thought I'd get hungry with just a lunchbox, so\nat lunchtime, I bought some melon bread.
Her eyes shone as if she were an explorer who had\ndiscovered treasure in a cave in some unexplored\nplace.
'A...are you sure?'
'Go ahead.'
'Thank you!!'
She took the melon bread, opened the wrapper\nimmediately and bit into the contents.
She was getting crumbs everywhere but really\nlooked like she was enjoying it as she devoured\nit greedily.
'It's so tasty! I haven't had any calorie intake\nfor ages!'
'(Could that be because she's poor?)'
The fact that she was so ecstatic over something\nlike melon bread actually made me quite worried.
She didn't show any signs that she was thinking\nof my generosity and just ate up the high calorie\nmelon bread.
'Whew, that was delicious...'
She murmured happily, looking happy as can be.\nShe looked like she was mulling over the taste of\nthe melon bread in her brain.
'The sugar is going to my brain... haha!'
She said as she turned back to the drawing board.
Then, she started drawing the plans again with\nincredible energy.
From the serious look on her face, it seemed that\nshe had already forgotten about me.
'(She's strange...)'
Not just a little, but very strange.
'Ok, well I'll be off now.'
'...Perhaps she didn't hear me.'
I put the melon bread wrapper that she had left\nbehind in my pocket and turned to leave.
I reluctantly left the special atmosphere of the\ngarage behind me.
'Well then, maybe I should head back.'
By the time I had finished watching the various\nclubs, the sky was orange as the sun was setting.
'Oh, there you are!'
Ageha was at the school gates.
Ageha looks towards me and points the cell phone\nshe is holding at me.
'I thought that if you were still here, we could\nleave together. I called you several times but\nyou didn't answer!'
I told Ageha that I would take a look at the club\nactivities before leaving.
'Can you look at the call history?'
'Hmm? I left it at the dormitory.'
'Huh? Why!? That defeats the purpose of having a\ncell phone!'
'Doesn't it say in the school rules that you\ncan't bring cell phones to school?'
'Y...yes, that's true but... does anyone actually\nfollow that rule?'
It's alright if you don't get caught, it seems.
In my case, I'm not so worried about the school\nrules, it's just too bothersome to carry a cell\nphone around with me.
'Tsk! Even though I have your number, it doesn't\nmean anything!'
'...Hmm? How do you know my number??'
Five years ago, when I left Kazegaura, I was\nstill just a kid, so I didn't have a cell phone.
'I got it from An-chan earlier. He gave me your\ntext address too, so I can bombard you with\ntexts!'
'What...? Don't bother, it's too much of a\nhassle.'
Writing texts on a cell phone is too fiddly,\nwhich is a real pain, so I don't really like it.
But it looks like Ageha isn't listening to me and\nhas started walking on ahead.
'OK, shall we head back?'
'How was your first day at your new school?'
'Hmmm... It seems like an interesting school.'
It was different to the sports schools or regular\nschools and had a special kind of atmosphere.
'Everyone looks like they enjoy it and it's, how\nshould I say, like they come here to hang out.'
'Ah ha ha ha, you could say that. Everyone comes\nhere because there are things that they want to\ndo.'
'Things they want to do...'
'Have you found a club you want to join?'
'...I dunno. There were a few that seemed\ninteresting though.'
'Here, the sports clubs aren't that great, so you\nmight find them kind of lacking.'
'What do you do, Ageha?'
'I'm in the Robotics Club. We make robots and\nenter contests.'
'Robots? That sounds interesting too.'
'You're always welcome, Aoi!'
'Yeah, I'll think about it.'
'Well then, I'm going this way.'
'Huh? Isn't your place around here?'
'Yeah but I moved. Didn't you know that Kazami\nShopping Street is no longer there because of the\nreconstruction?'
'No way, seriously?'
'They've made a huge shopping mall. My family's\nshop has moved there too.'
'I'll take you there when we have a day off. OK,\nsee you tomorrow.'
'Ah, hey...'
'What?'
'Thanks for everything today.'
'It's fine, it's fine. If you just buy me a\nparfait next time, that'll be enough.'
'No, umm... I mean...'
'...That you are the same way towards me as in\nthe past.'
'Ah... sure.'
'That was a big help.'
'Ha ha, me too. Apart from your appearance, you\nhaven't changed a bit.'
'Ah, and your appearance isn't that bad, either!'
'This is leaking some secret information but\ntoday, a few girls asked me to give them your\nphone number!'
'Seriously?'
'Correction: You've got quite an eye for the\nladies, haven't you, Aoi?'
'S...so what? I didn't have that kind of thing at\nan all-boys school.'
'Well, it proves that you're a normal, healthy\nboy. In the time since we last met, you've grown\nup.'
Ageha looked happy as she said that.
'So have you.'
To be honest, I thought she would have grown up\nto be more rough and tomboyish.
'Hehehe! That's right!'
Ageha started smiling quietly.
Looking at that innocent smile reminded me of how\nAgeha was when she was still just a kid.
'...Welcome back, Aoi.'
'Ah... yeah.'
'Haha... See you again tomorrow, old buddy!'
BAM!
'Ouch!!'
She gave me a great big slap on the back.
'See ya!'
Ageha gave me a big wave, and turned the corner.
'...Ouch... you dufus...'
She might have gotten a little cuter, but she\nhadn't really changed on the inside.
'Welcome back, huh?'
Her attitude hasn't really changed compared to\nbefore, and somehow I felt that it had saved me.
After Ageha and I went our separate ways, I went\nshopping for dinner on the way back.
'It's going to be hot again tomorrow. I'll have\nto make nutritious food to give them energy.'
Enthusiastically, I put the menu together in my\nhead.
'Oh no, I forgot to buy milk.'
There was a convenience store right in front of\nme.
Five years ago, there was a tobacconist here.
'It's a little expensive, but I don't have time\nto go back to the supermarket.'
I thought to myself...
'La la la!'
The automatic doors opened and the one with the\nself-proclaimed 'cool allure' left the shop.
She had a bag on her lap and she had a smile on\nher face which was the exact opposite of 'cool'.
She didn't notice me and went back in the\ndirection of the dormitory.
'...It's her.'
She didn't go to school, so what is she doing?
I gave up on buying the milk and followed Kotori.
When she got back to the dormitory, Kotori opened\nthe front door just slightly.
'Hat... Hat...!'
She called Hat from the other side of the door\nand spoke to him about something.
She was sneaking around and seemed really\nsuspicious.
'Go and see if he's here or not. You know, that\nguy, that mean boy.'
'(Is she talking about me...!?)'
This is a girl's dormitory, so I'm the only boy\nhere.
...I don't remember being 'mean' though.
I don't know why but it would appear that she is\nsneaking around to avoid being found by me.
'(If that's how you feel...)'
I headed for the back door to the dormitory.
I'll hide in the kitchen for now.
'Quack!'
'Shhh!'
'If this is about me, tell her I'm not here!'
'Quack...'
I doubt that he got the message but wiggled his\nbutt as he left the dining hall and headed for\nthe entrance.
While I'm waiting in ambush, I'll put the food I\nbought in the fridge.
After a little while...
'...Looks like he's not here. Alright.'
When Kotori came into the dining hall, she went\nstraight for the cupboard and took out a spoon.
Without taking out a dish, she stayed seated in\nher wheelchair.
She put the shopping bag from the convenience\nstore on the table.
Inside was...
'(...Hargen Darch?)'
Needless to say, it was top quality ice cream.
Not only that, but it was the family size.
It's the big tub that costs 2500 yen.
She opened the lid and in her right hand, she had\nthe type of spoon that you'd eat things like\ncurry with.
'(Gulp)... I'm finally gonna do it.'
'Quack!'
Kotori's spoon was still above the smooth surface\nof the Hargen Darch, then she dug a big hole in\nit!
One scoop like that would be about 100 yen, and\nshe stuffed the whole thing in one mouthful!
'Wheeeew...'
'...I'm so happy!'
She brought her hand to her cheek, as though she\nwas flooded in happiness from the bottom of her\nheart.
'(What is she doing...?)'
Seeing what she was doing made hiding and\nwatching her seem pretty ridiculous.
Without knowing I was watching, Kotori began to\nshovel in more ice cream like a construction\nmachine.
'Yum yum... Yummy yummy...'
Even if it was only a 105 yen ice cream, you'd\nsavor the flavor more than that.
'Yum yum, it's so yummy...!'
With the next mouthful of ice cream, Kotori\nsuddenly lowered her head, holding her temples.
'Quack?'
'Uunh... I...I'm OK. Just a little brain\nfreeze...'
To be able to get brain freeze from eating too\nmuch Hargen Darch is the very height of luxury.
During this little pause, Kotori opened up her\nnotebook.
There is something written there.
I sneak up a little closer behind her.
'Quack Quack!'
'(Shhhh!)'
Next to the words
*Eat as much Hargen Darch as I want.
Kotori happily wrote the word 'Done'.
'Hahaha... Mission complete!'
It seemed to be some sort of list.
'('Things I want to do'...?)'
That was the title and there were bullet points\nbelow.

*Stroke the head of the big dog in the
neighborhood. (it's really scary but it might be
unexpectedly friendly. If possible, I'd like to
ride around on its back.)
*Fill the bath with water and swim in it like a\npool.
*Pie-throwing.
And so on.
Among those was,
*Go and see Windmill Hill.
with 'Done' written next to it.
'What is this?'
'EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!!'
'Whooooaaaaaa!!!'
Kotori's scream pierced straight into my right\near and out my left.
'Wha, wha, wha, wha, wha, what are you doing!!?\nWhy, why are you here!!!!?'
'I was here before you were!'
'But... There's no way...'
Her mouth was open in shock as she looked at Hat.
'Quack?'
'Well, I guess it's no good sending a duck to\nscout the place out...'
Even if he was able to completely grasp what his\nresponsibility was, there's no way he could\nconvey the message.
Kotori seemed ashamed and looked away.
'I'm sorry I surprised you. You were sneaking\naround so I wondered what you were doing.'
I didn't mean to spoil her personal enjoyment.
'You really are mean...'
I went back to the kitchen to get things ready\nfor dinner.
Kotori's face seemed to say 'Now it only tastes\nhalf as good' as she sulkily ate the ice cream.
'Why are you taking time off school?'
'I caught a cold. Cough, cough!'
She's blatantly lying.
Would someone who has caught a cold be eating ice\ncream?
'I'm the dorm mother, you know. I have to make\nsure the boarding students have the right kind of\nlifestyle.'
'I don't remember accepting you as the dorm\nmother.'
'Anyway, isn't it strange for a boy to be a dorm\nmother?'
Swoosh!
She went through the trouble of turning around so\nthat she could point at me.
'If you want to call me dorm father then that's\nfine by me!'
'Hmph!'
Kotori turned back around and went back to\nenjoying her ice cream.
'If you weren't at school, then where were you?'
I soften my tone a little as I ask her.
'It has nothing to do with you.'
'Did you go back to the Windmill Hill?'
She's ignoring me and eating her ice cream.
'It has something to do with me.'
'I won't accept you as the dorm mother.'
'I don't mean that.'
'Yesterday, if I hadn't been passing by, where\nwould you be right now?'
'If you're not careful in a place like that, then\nmaybe nobody would have come.'
'If you can't move your wheelchair, what would\nyou have done by yourself?'
'Unh... That's...'
'Do you still think it has nothing to do with\nme?'
I'm not accusing her of anything.
That's why I tried to speak as gently as\npossible, as to not sound too harsh.
However, I showed her how serious I was.
'...Look, I said 'thank you', didn't I? For me to\nthank anyone is extremely rare, you know!'
'It's true! It's as rare as a giant salamander!\nYou should be the one thanking me!'
'Are you proud of that? If you think that people\nwould be happy because it's so rare, you're\nseverely mistaken!'
'Hrmm...'
Kotori seemed daunted by this sound argument, put\ndown the spoon and started thinking seriously.
'...But, because I'm like this, I can't do\nanything.'
'Do you want some ice cream? It's really\nexpensive...'
'No I don't.'
I sounded a little mean, so Kotori...
'Sniff...'
became tearful all of a sudden.
Her cheeks were quivering as she desperately\ntried to hold back the tears.
'H...hey, I'm sorry, I was joking! Don't make\nthat face!'
'It's nothing... I'm fine...'
'That's right, see, you're fine!'
'Quack, quack!'
Hat quacked as though he was trying to cheer\nKotori up.
'I wouldn't tell you to say 'thank you', would\nI?'
'It's just that if you go out without telling\nanyone where you're going, it's kind of\ndangerous... You know?'
She wiped the corner of her eye a little with her\nfinger.
'I understand but... I don't want to understand.'
'Do I have to understand?'
Somehow that's what the look on her face said.
She put the spoon down and went to leave the\ndining hall.
'Where are you going?'
'I'm going to wash my face. It's all sticky\naround my mouth from where I've been eating ice\ncream... sniff...'
She closed the notebook and put it on her lap.
Then, a piece of paper fell from the notebook.
'You dropped something.'
Kotori looked as though she hadn't heard, and\nleft the dining hall.
Hat went after her.
As the sound of the wheelchair grew distant, I\nlet out a big sigh.
'...Maybe I said too much.'
It's just that I really was worried about her.
I don't know anything about what's going on with\nKotori, so perhaps I was unnecessarily\ninterfering.
'Wait...'
Speaking of which, she was wearing her uniform.
However, she was wearing her own clothes\nyesterday when she went to Windmill Hill.
'Could it be that she was actually planning on\ngoing to school?'
That's possible, isn't it?
As I thought of that, I felt my mood lighten a\nlittle, and I picked up the piece of paper that\nshe had dropped.
For a moment, I couldn't believe my eyes.
It was a notice for withdrawal from school.
'Hey, cheer up, Aoi!'
I was depressed while I was cleaning up after\ndinner, and Kanako came to comfort me.
'Why...? Why did everyone leave so much uneaten?'
'It was really tasty though!'
For tonight's dinner, Kanako was the only one who\nate all of her food.
Without exception, everyone else left some\nuneaten.
'Tomorrow, I'll make food that is even tastier.\nSo tasty that no one will leave anything\nuneaten!'
I felt renewed determination, and then the duck\ncame waddling into the dining hall.
'Hello, senior Hat!'
'Quack!'
'I see, you're hungry? Aoi, do you have something\nfor him to eat?'
'Umm... there're some vegetables left over.'
'That'll do.'
Kanako took the leftover vegetables and fed them\nto Hat.
'Is this duck her pet? Are you allowed to have\npets here?'
'Nope, he's no one's pet.'
'Quaaack!'
'He's been living here since before I came here.\nIt's not clear who brought him here or when.\nThat's why I call him senior Hat.'
'So the owner must've been keeping him.'
'No, that's not it either. She said that Hat just\nappeared one day.'
'That's why, rather than being a pet, he's more\nlike a housemate.'
Kotori also called him a 'housemate'.
'Quack quack!'
'It's a mystery...'
Once she had finished feeding Hat, Kanako got out\nof her seat.
'OK, I think I'll go take a bath.'
'Don't go walking around in your underwear again,\nOK?'
'Huh, why not? Come on, it's summer!'
'No!'
'Spoilsport!'
Kanako gave me a quick insult as she left the\ndining hall.
'...Why does everyone have to insult me just\nbefore they leave?'
I felt a little hurt as I cleaned the dishes.
Peek...
This time, it was Kotori poking her head into the\ndining hall.
It was almost as if she was waiting for Kanako to\nleave before she came in.
'(She doesn't seem to get along well with her, so\nmaybe she really was waiting for her to\nleave...)'
I thought she might have to come to have dinner\nbut she appeared to be looking for something.
She's looking under the table.
'Hat, you're in the way.'
'Quack quack!'
She went around the table once and then came past\nthe counter, in front of me.
'Hey... Have you seen a piece of paper?'
'No, I haven't. What kind of paper?'
'Paper is paper. ...Are you sure you haven't seen\nit?'
'Positive.'
'Unnnh...'
Kotori groaned while staring at my face as if she\nwere trying to see if I was telling the truth.
With a straight face, I wiped the dishes with a\ntowel.
With no way to check, she went to look elsewhere.
'I'll put your dinner in the fridge. Heat it up\nin the microwave and eat it later, OK?'
I couldn't help lying to her.
The thing she was looking for was the withdrawal\nnotice that I had picked up.
...People were worried that 'If it carries on\nlike this, she'll stop coming altogether.
...'It looks like she's not really enjoying\nschool.
Ageha's words crossed my mind.
It looks like Kotori really is planning to drop\nout of school.
'...What am I doing?'
Why didn't I give the withdrawal notice back to\nher?
There I stood, not even really understanding\nthese feelings myself.
